FuncDef:
The macsec replay-window command sets the MACsec replay window size.
The undo macsec replay-window command restores the default MACsec replay window size.
By default, the MACsec replay window size is 64.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the size of a MACsec replay window.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 1024.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To prevent against attacks based on repeatedly sent data packets, the receiver discards duplicate or out-of-order data packets by default. In some cases, however, because the priorities of data packets are different, the packets are reordered in the forwarding process. When the packets arrive at the receive end, they are in disorder. To ensure that these out-of-order data packets can be received normally, configure the replay protection window.
